intro: Sclerotheca oreades, commonly known as the rock cress, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to rocky and alpine environments. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant has a compact growth form with hairy leaves and produces small, yellow or white flowers in early spring. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Sclerotheca oreades is adapted to harsh conditions, making it a resilient species in mountainous regions.
